## Guidance on effective visual communication

<br>
Effective graphs

::: incremental
- Intuitive, legible
- Proximity and alignment to facilitate comparison
- Use labels and annotations to add clarity to the message


:::


::: footer
:::


## Guidance on effective visual communication

<br>

- Effective graphs

- Show **data** clearly

::: incremental
- Avoid misrepresentation (use appropriate scales)
- **Choose appropriate graph** type to display your data
:::

## Guidance on Improving visual communication

<br>

- Communication



::: incremental
- Have a clear purpose
    - Know the purpose of creating the graph
    - Identify the quantitative evidence to support the purpose
    - Identify the audience and focus the design to support their needs


:::


::: footer
:::



## Summary

<br>

Let your research question and data drive the plot choice

::: incremental
- build effective graphs
- visuals that are intuitive and legible because their geometry matches the variables
:::
::: footer
:::

## Summary

<br>

Design question to what you want to reveal in the data:

::: incremental
- comparison, distribution, relationship, or composition
:::
::: footer
:::
